article.headline: Arkansas 67, Stephen F.Austin 51
article.story: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. -- Michael Washington scored 17 points and grabbed 13 rebounds to lead Arkansas to a 67-51 win against Stephen F. Austin on Saturday. Washington was one of four Arkansas players to score in double figures, joining Courtney Fortson (13 points), Stefan Welsh (12) and Jason Henry (12). The double-double was Washington's third straight and fifth this season. He played a pivotal role in an 11-0 run that gave Arkansas (8-1) a 35-24 lead at halftime. Washington started the spurt with consecutive dunks and ended the half with a blocked shot at the buzzer. After Stephen F. Austin cut the deficit to 36-30 early in the second half, Washington scored six more points during a 14-4 Arkansas run that helped the Razorbacks hold their lead. Josh Alexander scored 17 points for the Lumberjacks (6-3).

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
